name: makeovermonday_w102018-what-policymakers-know-about-women-and-girl-issues
title: 2018/W10: What Policymakers know about Women and Girl Issues
description:
What Policymakers know about Women and Girl Issues

# **Original Visualization**
![week 10 original.png](https://media.data.world/333mFENRQKQqPJHtsG09_week%2010%20original.png)

# **About this Dataset**
SOURCE: [Equal Measures 2030](http://www.equalmeasures2030.org/products/policymaker-report)

This week's Makeover Monday challenge is a collaboration with Tableau Public and Equal Measures 2030 in celebration of International Women's Day.

The data provided shows the responses by policy makers across a number of countries when asked for their judgement of different issues relating to women in girls in their country.

The data contains a *'correct answer'* with, for example, the rate at which women participate in the labor force. 

Then there is a column with the *guess or estimate* by the policy makers.
For labor participation, a guess that is higher than the correct answer is an overestimation, i.e. people think the situation is better than it is in reality.

For early marriage rates (the percentage of women currently aged 20-24 who were married before reaching the age of 18), an estimate below the correct answer means policy makers are underestimating how frequent these early marriages are.



# **Objectives**

* What works and what doesn't work with this chart? 
* How can you make it better? 
* Post your alternative on the discussions page.

fields.name: respondent_code
fields.title: Respondent code
fields.description:
The respondent code refers to individual policy makers who responded to this survey.
There are different numbers of respondents for the different countries

fields.name: country
fields.title: Country
fields.description: The country about which the policy makers has been asked in this survey. Questions relate to the 5 different measures as they affect the country listed here

fields.name: early_marriage_rate_response_type
fields.title: Early marriage rate (response type)
fields.description:
The response type to the question:
1 = I know this
2 = I don’t recall, but I know where to find this information 
3 = I don’t know, and don’t know where to find this information
4 = [ASK IF 2 or 3] What would be your estimate

fields.name: estimate_guess_early_marriage_rate
fields.title: Estimate/guess -  Early marriage rate
fields.description:
Respondents were asked to guess the **Early marriage rate** (percentage) with the latest year available from 2005 to present
Parameters: Percentage of women aged 20‐24 who were married before reaching age 18

fields.name: correct_answer_early_marriage_rate_in_2015
fields.title: Correct answer - Early marriage rate in 2015

fields.name: estimate_guess_share_of_seats_held_by_women_in_parliament_in_2016

fields.description:
Respondents were asked to guess the **Share of seats held by women in parliament in 2016** (percentage)
Parameters: Proportion of seats held by women in the national parliament expressed as percentage of total seats.
